decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to generate mana and control the board with creatures like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker until you can assemble the Broodscale Bloodchief combo with Eldrazi Temple and Blade of the Bloodchief. This combo allows you to deal massive damage to your opponent while gaining significant life. Additionally, cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek?s Command help disrupt your opponent?s strategy, while Urza?s Saga can tutor for key pieces of your combo. Overall, this deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo and overwhelming your opponent with powerful synergies.

This combo deck focuses on quickly generating mana using spells like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion to cast powerful spells like Glimpse the Impossible and Past in Flames to continuously generate even more mana and spells. Using cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wrenn's Resolve to control the board and draw cards, the deck aims to quickly storm off and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and damage. This deck is all about explosive plays and chaining together spells to win the game in a single turn.

The main concept of this Affinity deck is to quickly establish a board presence while disrupting your opponent with artifact removal and countermagic. By utilizing efficient creatures like Memnite and Pinnacle Emissary, along with strong artifacts like Mox Opal and Engineered Explosives, you aim to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The inclusion of cards like Tormod's Crypt and Weapons Manufacturing also provides additional utility and disruption options, allowing you to control the pace of the game and create advantageous situations for yourself.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana generation and card draw to assemble a combo involving Ral, Monsoon Mage and other spells like Grapeshot to deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes past in flames to recur key spells from the graveyard. The main win condition is to cast a high storm count spell like Grapeshot to finish off the opponent in a single turn. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan to win the game efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively control the game with a mix of disruptive cards and efficient creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's strategy while deploying threats like Emperor of Bones and Nethergoyf, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control. The deck also utilizes powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple to further enhance its strategy and punish opponents who are unprepared for its aggressive gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, then bring them back onto the battlefield using reanimation spells like Persist and Unearth. Thoughtseize and Spell Pierce help disrupt opponent's plans while Faithless Looting and Thought Scour dig for combo pieces. Fatal Push and other removal spells keep the board clear for your big creatures to take over. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful creatures that are difficult to deal with once they hit the battlefield.

This deck focuses on generating as much mana as possible with cards like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion to cast a large number of spells in a single turn. The goal is to dig through the deck with cards like Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible to find combo pieces like Past in Flames and Grapeshot, allowing for a massive storm count and lethal damage to be dealt to the opponent. Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wish help to generate additional value and control the game, while Valakut Awakening can be used as a reset button if needed.

Ramp and control your opponent's board with powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells that disrupt their game plan. Use the Urza lands to quickly generate mana and cast big threats like Ulamog and Karn. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provides additional board control while Thought-Knot Seer disrupts your opponent's hand. Karn, the Great Creator can shut down artifact-based strategies, and a mix of removal spells and Chalice of the Void help keep your opponent in check. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with powerful threats while maintaining control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and play powerful Eldrazi creatures. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker while also utilizing Karn, the Great Creator to shut down artifacts. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger provide additional win conditions, making it difficult for the opponent to recover once the deck establishes control of the game.

This deck utilizes cards that cycle through your library to quickly fill up your graveyard, allowing you to cast Living End to bring back all your creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield. The key strategy is to quickly cycle through your deck, disrupting your opponent's game plan with counterspells and disruptive creatures, and then overwhelm them with a powerful board presence when you cast Living End. By utilizing a mix of cycling creatures, counterspells, and powerful creatures that can be brought back from the graveyard, this deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramp spells and mana acceleration to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also includes control elements like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The Eldrazi Temple and Ugin's Labyrinth help to generate additional mana for casting larger threats, while cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms provide additional sources of card advantage and removal. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of big mana generation with Urza lands, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with Eldrazi creatures and powerful sorceries. Karn, the Great Creator serves as a versatile tool to shut down opposing strategies, while Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger provide powerful finishers. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of board control and card advantage, ultimately overwhelming them with its powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble a combo using cards like Lotus Bloom and Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive damage to opponents. By using counterspells like Counterspell and Disrupting Shoal, as well as control spells like Into the Flood Maw and Jwari Disruption, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. Additionally, cards like Sea Gate Restoration and Preordain help with card advantage, while Tameshi, Reality Architect and Hydroelectric Specimen provide additional utility and synergies within the deck.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature strategies, combining efficient creature spells like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Mana Tithe and elegant Parlor to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck utilizes a mix of lands like Windswept Heath and Sacred Foundry to ensure a smooth mana base, and includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to close out games.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to swarm the board with fast and aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, supported by cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment. This deck aims to deal quick and consistent damage to the opponent while controlling the board with cards like Thraben Charm and Galvanic Discharge. The inclusion of cards like Mana Tithe and Lightning Bolt provide additional utility and removal options. The deck also utilizes lands like Flooded Strand and Windswept Heath to ensure consistent mana fixing and card draw.

The main strategy of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck relies on efficient mana fixing with fetch lands and a mix of white and red mana sources. Blood Moon is included as a disruptive element to slow down opponents relying on non-basic lands. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide powerful late-game threats, while Goblin Bombardment offers additional reach and removal. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure while maintaining a versatile and adaptable game plan.
